intro: Phyteuma jacquinii, commonly known as the Jacob's beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, upright stem. Phyteuma jacquinii is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and drought tolerance.
